src.reader module#

Photogrammetry site file reader module

src.reader.from_file(file: str, skip: int | None = None) → Worksite[source]#

Photogrammetric site file reading function

Parameters:

  • file (str) – Path to the worksite.

  • skip (int) – Number of lines to be skipped before reading the file, Default=None.

Returns:

The worksite

Return type:

Worksite

src.reader.from_opk(file: str, skip: int = 1) → Worksite[source]#

Reads an opk file to transform it into a Workside object

Parameters:

  • file (str) – Path to the worksite.

  • skip (int) – Number of lines to be skipped before reading the file, Default=None.

Returns:

The worksite

Return type:

Worksite

Bases: object

Acquisition data class

src.worksite module#

Worksite data class module

class src.worksite.Worksite(name: str)[source]#

Bases: object

Worksite class

add_shot(name_shot: str, pos_shot: array, ori_shot: array, name_cam: str) → None[source]#

Add Shot to the attribut Shots

Parameters:

  • name_shot (str) – Name of the shot.

  • pos_shot (numpy.array) – Array of coordinate position [X, Y, Z].

  • ori_shot (numpy.array) – Array of orientation of the shot [Omega, Phi, Kappa].

  • name_cam (str) – Name of the camera.

src.writer module#

Photogrammetry site file reader module

src.writer.to_opk(path: str, work: Worksite) → None[source]#

Write function, to save a photogrammetric site in .opk format

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path of registration file.

  • work (Worksite) – The site to be recorded.
